visualization_prompt: Create a Highcharts chartOptions object to render a column chart with the following specifications: The chart should display monthly rainfall data for two different years. The chart title should be 'Monthly Rainfall Comparison'. The x-axis should have labels for each month from January to December. The y-axis should display the total rainfall in millimeters with a black-colored label. The chart should use stacking to show the cumulative rainfall for each month. The data series should include two series, each representing rainfall data for a different year. The chart should have a white background and a legend positioned at the top right corner.
visualization_explanation: The provided Highcharts chartOptions object is configured to render a column chart that compares monthly rainfall data for two different years. The chart is titled 'Monthly Rainfall Comparison' and has a white background. The x-axis displays labels for each month from January to December, styled with a dark gray color and a font size of 12px. The y-axis is labeled 'Rainfall (mm)' with a dark gray color and a font size of 14px. The y-axis also includes stack labels that show the total rainfall in millimeters, styled in black with a font size of 12px. The chart uses stacking to show the cumulative rainfall for each month. The data series includes two sets of monthly rainfall data, each representing a different year. The legend is positioned at the top right corner of the chart, providing a clear distinction between the two data series.
